DOC.detailed_description: This study examine effectiveness Sexuality Education Initiative ( SEI ) , comprehensive , multi-component , rights-based sexuality education program develop implement Planned Parenthood Los Angeles high school student . The primary goal SEI improve sexual reproductive health youth attend Los Angeles high school . The SEI consist four intervention component : ( 1 ) 12-session gender-sensitive , rights-based , comprehensive sexuality education curriculum , ( 2 ) peer education advocacy component , ( 3 ) parent education component , ( 4 ) clinical service linkage . - The 12-session gender-sensitive , rights-based classroom curriculum cover anatomy , abstinence , contraception protection , STIs HIV/AIDS , medium message , gender , relationship , right responsibility , pregnancy , sexuality , peer pressure , negotiation coercion , decision making . - The peer education advocacy component recruit , train supervise student after-school leadership program serve school-wide resource peer , organize health event school , refer student school-based clinic service . - The parent education component consist series session parent , cover reproductive health , teen pregnancy , parent-teen communication , together parent education booklet widespread use . - The in-school clinical service component provide `` clinic without wall '' health service campus , include pregnancy STI testing , contraceptive consultation prescription , condom distribution , counseling , referral . It also train teacher school staff distribute condom student need . The evaluation design involve two level randomization : First , school randomize one two condition : receiving three SEI school wide component ( peer , parent , clinical service ) receive one three school wide component ( clinical service ) . Schools randomize within match pair demographically similar school . Second , within school , classroom randomize one two condition : basic 3-session sex education curriculum ( control ) 12-session SEI curriculum ( intervention ) . Thus , participate 9th grade student receive least three sexuality education curriculum session access on-site clinic service . The primary research question evaluation : 1 . Is 12-session SEI gender-sensitive , rights-based sexuality education curriculum effective 3-session comparison curriculum reduce risk unwanted pregnancy sexually transmit infection ( STIs ) among high school student ? 2 . Is full comprehensive program ( four component package ) effective two-component comparison condition ( 3-session comparison curriculum clinical service linkage ) reduce risk teen pregnancy STIs ? The first hypothesis 12-session SEI gender-sensitive , rights-based curriculum effective 3-session comparison curriculum improve sexual health outcome ( define section 7 ) among program participant one year participation program . The second hypothesis full SEI program ( four component package ) effective comparison condition ( 3-session comparison curriculum clinical service linkage ) improve sexual health outcome one year participation .
